channel.title: targetgenerator on nray
channel.description: Recent content in targetgenerator on nray

item.title: standard
item.description: This is the standard target generator that is probably going to be used most of the time. It takes a list of IPs, CIDR networks or domain names as targets and black list as well as a list of TCP and UDP ports to be scanned. enabled: true Enables or disables this target generator. targets: [] A list of targets to scan. May be (also a mix of) CIDR networks, IPs or domain names.

item.title: certificatetransparency
item.description: The certificatetransparency streams data from certstream, a certificate transparency log stream. This allows to inspect all publicly issued certificates. Using this data, port scans may be issued against targets right after they obtain a certificate, usually during setup before any hardening or default password changes have been in place. This may come in handy for bug bounties - nray authors BTW love to get invited for a coffee

item.title: ldap
item.description: The ldap target generator allows to connect to a ldap server in order to identify scan targets. Especially in Active Directory environments this is really useful since computer objects have a dNSHostName property and Domain Controllers usually act also as DNS servers that can be queried via LDAP. enabled: false Enables or disables this target generator. ldapSearchString: "(objectCategory=computer)" The ldap search to perform for selecting objects. In Active Directory environments, (objectCategory=computer) can be used to select all computer objects.
